title: Buck Southworth: U.S. Air Force Flight Crew

sources.title: Buck Southworth: U.S. Air Force Flight Crew
sources.description:
The first soviet disaster movie "Air Crew"

During the flight, the plane with passengers on board enters the earthquake zone. The car receives numerous damages, and only thanks to the courage and dedication of the pilots, the flight can be successfully completed.

IMDb rating: 7,4

Year of production: 1979

Directed by: Mitta Alexander
Screenwriters: Julius Dunsky, Alexander Mitta, Valery Frid
Composer: Alfred Schnittke

Cast: Yuri Gorobets, Alexandra Yakovleva, Anatoly Alexandrovich Vasilyev, Georgy Zhzhenov, Ekaterina Vasilyeva, Alexander Pavlov, Galina Gladkova, Irina Akulova, Roma Monin, Leonid Filatov, Kurihara Komaki

- Prize "for the brightness and entertainment of the film dedicated to the feat of the Soviet man" at the XIII VKF in Dushanbe (1980)
- The main prize of the Society of Czechoslovak-Soviet Friendship at the International Film Festival of the Workers of Czechoslovakia (Czechoslovakia) (1981)
- Prize of the Union of Composers of Tajikistan for the music for the film Schnittke A.G. at the XIII VKF in Dushanbe (1980)

metadata.Plot: In this short documentary, the life story of Buck Southworth as U.S. Air Force Flight Crew in the Vietnam War is told and narrated by his wife, Priscilla Southworth, now a Cemetery Volunteer at Cape Canaveral National Cemetery. This is a remarkable and touching documentary about bravery, mission and love.
metadata.Writer: Daniel L. Bernardi, Jesse Collier Sutterley
